node.title: Poland Uses Water Cannons and Tear Gas as Tensions Rise at Belarus Border
node.alt: A Polish military truck near the border with Belarus on Saturday. Thousands of migrants, mainly from the Middle East, have flown to Belarus in the hope of finding a path into the European Union.
node.description: Western leaders have accused President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko of Belarus of using migrants as weapons in an effort to pressure the European Union.
node.content: ["WARSAW \u2014 The Polish authorities said that border guards used water cannons and tear gas on Tuesday to repel what they said was an attempt by migrants moving en masse from Belarus to breach the heavily guarded frontier.", "Tensions have been building along the European Union\u2019s eastern front for weeks as thousands of migrants, mainly from the Middle East, have flown to Belarus in the hope of finding a path into the bloc. The E.U. member states that share a border with Belarus \u2014 Latvia, Lithuania and Poland \u2014 have accused the government of Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, the Belarus leader, of orchestrating what they say is a \u201chybrid attack\u201d using human beings as weapons.", "After several nights of tense standoffs, tensions flared on Tuesday morning.", "The Polish authorities, in a series of Twitter messages, said that border guards at the Kuznica-Bruzgi crossing had been assaulted by people throwing \u201cstones, bottles and logs\u201d and firing \u201cstun grenades.\u201d", "\u201cThe entire aggressive behavior is coordinated by Belarusian services and monitored by drones,\u201d the Polish authorities said, posting videos of the confrontations. \u201cAs a result of an attack by people inspired by the Belarusian side, one of the policemen was seriously injured.\u201d", "The officer was being treated at a hospital for what was believed to be a skull fracture, the authorities said.", "Since the Polish government has banned journalists from reporting at the border, it was impossible to verify the authorities\u2019 claims or the veracity of the scores of videos that appeared on social media purporting to show snippets of the confrontation.", "The Lukashenko government has denied allegations, including from the United States, that it has engineered the crisis and is directing the movement of the migrants.", "\u201cWe cannot let this so-called problem lead to heated confrontation,\u201d Mr. Lukashenko told a government meeting on Tuesday, according to Belta, the state news agency.", "\u201cThe main thing now is to protect our country and our people, and not to allow clashes,\u201d he added.", "The number of migrants at the border started to grow after Belarus eased its visa rules in August. Western leaders say that Mr. Lukashenko \u2014 who is facing E.U. sanctions for his brutal crackdown on the political opposition and the forcing down of a Ryanair flight over Belarus to arrest a dissident journalist \u2014 is using migrants to gain leverage over the bloc.", "Since the migration crisis of 2015, when more than a million migrants and asylum seekers tried to enter the European Union, the bloc has tightened border controls and declared that uncontrolled migration is no longer possible.", "But the issue remains potentially explosive, and Poland\u2019s nationalist government, which has been steadily losing support in the polls, has moved to seize on the moment.", "Poland\u2019s chief central banker, Adam Glapinski \u2014 a longtime friend and ally of Poland\u2019s de facto leader Jaroslaw Kaczynski \u2014 announced this week that the National Bank of Poland would issue a collectors\u2019 note and coin dedicated to the \u201cdefense of the Polish eastern border.\u201d", "Mr. Kaczynski recently announced a meeting in Warsaw next month for like-minded right-wing leaders \u2014 including Victor Orban of Hungary and Matteo Salvini of Italy \u2014 to discuss the future of the European Union and the need for stronger emphasis on national sovereignty and \u201ctraditional values.\u201d", "The border crisis comes as relations between Brussels and Warsaw have tanked, with the European Union accusing the Polish government of undermining the rule of law and dismantling the independence of the judiciary.", "But as the migrant crisis has grown, the bloc has lent its full support to Poland and the other nations on its eastern border.", "With Russia lending support to Belarus, the humanitarian crisis unfolding at the border threatens to spiral into a broader regional conflagration. And as colder temperatures begin to grip the region, there are fears of further tragedy among the migrants, with thousands of men, women and children stranded in freezing conditions between the razor wire and border guards."]
